instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> repaired ok but now Single beep.
threads.message:
Hi guys,

this one was dead and came back to life after replacing <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> but it now beeps when you press power button. It keeps beeping once every sec or so... I checked various memory modules on both slots and verified that <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_MEM_A</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_MEM_B</SIGNAL> are present at 1.5V (<CAPACITOR>C3110</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C3210</CAPACITOR>) after power on.

What could be causing this?

br,
george

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> repaired ok but now Single beep.
threads.message:
That is bad. Was this fucked with by someone else before?
Could be a problem on the I2C bus for the memory. Check Diode mode on <RESISTOR>R5200</RESISTOR>/01 on the data bus side. Could be fucked up express slot cable/connector shorting the data lines, disconnect it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> repaired ok but now Single beep.
threads.message:
hi duke,

this is an old whore so its definitely fucked by others - I checked <RESISTOR>R5200</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5201</RESISTOR>, diode mode 0.490, 3.33 to 3.40V when powered on. I also removed the flex from J3500 to no avail.

after 4-5 tries it stopped beeping and <RESISTOR>R5201</RESISTOR>/02 (<SIGNAL>SMBUS_MCP_0_DATA</SIGNAL>) reads 1,1V momentarily - same time the fans seems to pause for a few mseconds - like a restart (it doesn't chime so cant tell for sure).

couple of tries later the beeping is back.

fucker.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> repaired ok but now Single beep.
threads.message: Yeah, probably fucked up MCP or something. I would know where I would put this board.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> repaired ok but now Single beep.
threads.message:
yeah I suspect the MCP too... since I have the tools for an easy MCP swap I will give it a try and if that fails this board goes ..well you know where.

thanks a lot dude.
